description: Providing UK students with funding, making sure they maintain their account and repay loans.
title: Student finance: applications for full-time study

department.title: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

transaction.title: Student finance: applications for full-time study

description-extra:
The service is provided by different organisations for each country in the UK:
- England – the Student Loans Company
- Scotland – Student Awards Agency for Scotland
- Wales and Northern Ireland – local authorities
costs: The total cost for all aspects of processing a student finance application including: mail handling, staff processing time, customer advice, subsequent payment (up to 9 per applicant per annum), identity assurance, data sharing with higher education institutions and UCAS. The transactional costs quoted are approximate and subject to refinement.

modules.title: Transactions per year
info: Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

modules.title: Total cost
info: The total cost for all aspects of processing a student finance application including: mail handling, staff processing time, customer advice, subsequent payment (up to 9 per applicant per annum), identity assurance, data sharing with higher education institutions and UCAS. The transactional costs quoted are approximate and subject to refinement.
Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: The total cost for all aspects of processing a student finance application including: mail handling, staff processing time, customer advice, subsequent payment (up to 9 per applicant per annum), identity assurance, data sharing with higher education institutions and UCAS. The transactional costs quoted are approximate and subject to refinement.
Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.
